Articles.Content:
The in-flight map mode very much needs to have an object filter like the one in the Tracking Station, otherwise every time I'm trying to, let's say, pick Minmus as my target to see the inclination difference, the cursor instead "singles out" one of the spacecraft landed on Minmus, so I have to click "focus" on that, zoom in, then click on Minmus once it's close enough for the cursor to "notice" it. It's not game-breaking or anything, but it's a small annoyance that adds up over time.

 

There are also two small tweaks to the trajectory interface that would be very welcome:

1) Being able to create a maneuver *precisely* at Ap/Pe/other important points of the trajectory. I can already click on them to show the info card, just add a "create maneuver here" button to that.

2) Being able to create a maneuver within the "local frame" version of the trajectory going through a different SOI. I understand that this is probably a lot more challenging on the programming level, but literally every time I want to set a deceleration burn when going to the Mun after setting up the encounter, I go to the local trajectory (the one shown inside the Mun's SOI) to do it, then remember I can't and have to wait until I timeskip into the SOI (because trying to set up a deceleration burn around the Mun in the Kerbal-centric frame of reference just doesn't work since all the maneuver node directions are in relation to Kerbin).
